communication.message: [coordination-seeking] As the Retailer, I have 88 units in inventory and 0 units of backlog. My total profit so far is $551.20, which I'd like to maintain and grow. To do that, I propose we coordinate our ordering and production to keep the supply chain stable and profitable for all of us.  [information-sharing] I plan to order 12 units this round to meet the recent demand. I'm curious to hear what the rest of you are planning, so we can align our strategies and avoid any disruptions. [collaboration-proposal] Perhaps we could all agree to a 1-round cover strategy, where each stage keeps just enough inventory to meet the next round's expected demand. This should help us minimize costs while ensuring reliable fulfillment. I'm open to other ideas as well - the key is that we work together to maximize total supply chain profits. [confidence] 0.8

communication.message: [information-sharing] As the Retailer, I currently have 75 units in inventory and 0 units in backlog. My recent demand has been 12 and 13 units, and my last order placed was for 12 units. My total profit so far is $578.70, with a profit margin of $2.5 per unit sold. [coordination-seeking] To maximize our collective profits, I propose that we coordinate on a shared target of maintaining around 1 round of inventory cover across the supply chain. This will help us avoid costly stock-outs and excess inventory. I'm planning to order 12 units this round, but I'm open to adjusting that based on what the other agents have in mind. Please share your current states and proposed order quantities so we can align our strategies.
